node.title: 'No longer safe' - Police say children should leave Wellington protest
node.description: Police say they have serious concerns for 30 children at the Wellington anti-mandate protests, and are now urging parents to take them home.

node.title: DNA links woman's 1982 hotel murder to man slain months later
node.description: Authorities said they are trying to determine if the Lee Rotatori's murder and Thomas Freeman's death are somehow linked.

node.title: Opioid peddlers reach $26 billion settlement with states
node.description: "It's not enough, but it's a good start," one lawyer said of settlement to fund local treatment and education efforts.

node.title: CDC revises guidelines on who should mask indoors
node.description: New guidance issued by the agency adds an emphasis on hospitalization data to decide COVID-19 measures.

node.title: Inflation is hurting your 401(k), too. Here's what to do about it.
node.description: While no perfect playbook exists, these areas of the markets could hold up better than others — if not outright win — in a high-inflation world

node.title: South Africa set foundation for fightback against Black Caps
node.description: Rookie opener Sarel Erwee struck his maiden century as South Africa enjoyed a bright start in the second test against New Zealand.

node.title: Passion fruit growers lose up to 80% of crop to Fusarium disease
node.description: Fusarium - also known as passion fruit wilt - is a fungus that infects the plant through the roots, travels up the plant stem and cause the leaves to yellow, killing the plant.

node.title: Key inflation gauge hits 6.1%, highest level since 1982
node.description: Americans are increasingly pessimistic about the economy, with consumer sentiment falling to its lowest in a decade.

node.title: Senators react to Biden's Supreme Court pick
node.description: Ketanji Brown Jackson was confirmed to the U.S. Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit a year ago in a bipartisan 53–44 vote.

node.title: Sailor faces court martial for alleged role in fire that destroyed Navy ship
node.description: The fire marked one of the worst noncombat warship disasters in recent memory and the vessel had to be scrapped.

node.title: Recipe: Mardi Gras King Cake
node.description: This recipe for a sweet Carnival tradition is courtesy of the New Orleans Culinary & Hospitality Institute.

node.title: Former champion boxers plan to take up arms and fight for Ukraine
node.description: Former heavyweight champ Vitali Klitschko said Ukraine is already fighting a "bloody war" and he doesn't have "another choice" but to help fight.

node.title: TV shows canceled or ended in 2022
node.description: "Bull," "The Walking Dead," even Ellen -- here's what, and who, is leaving your TV.

node.title: James Inhofe, GOP Oklahoma senator, to retire at end of year
node.description: The Oklahoman's retirement is set to spark a special election and a likely competitive primary among Republicans.

node.title: Russia stripped of major events as invasion of Ukraine intensifies
node.description: Sports bodies have moved quickly to strip Russia of events, including the Champions League final and Formula One Grand Prix in Sochi.

node.title: Missiles hit Kyiv awaiting Russian assault, Ukrainian leader pleads for help
node.description: Missiles pounded the Ukrainian capital on Friday as Russian forces pressed their advance and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy pleaded with the international community to do more, saying…

node.title: Kimberly Guilfoyle's meeting with Jan. 6 committee goes awry
node.description: Guilfoyle, an adviser to former President Trump, abruptly ended a private conversation she was having with the committee Friday.

node.title: Capitol rioter who took Pelosi's podium sentenced to prison
node.description: Adam Johnson admitted posing with Pelosi's lectern was a "very stupid idea."

node.title: Recipe: Mashama Bailey's Chicken Country Captain
node.description: The James Bear Award-winning chef from The Grey, in Savannah, Ga., offers "Sunday Morning" viewers her slowly-braised curried chicken in a rich broth.

node.title: Book excerpt: "Black Ops: The Life of a CIA Shadow Warrior"
node.description: A retired undercover operative for U.S. intelligence, Ric Prado writes of finding his purpose defending American ideals against insurgents, terrorists, and traffickers of people, drugs, and illegal weapons.

node.title: Long Island chef Joe Reale faces off for National Clam Chowder Day on "The Talk"
node.description: It's National Clam Chowder Day, so chefs from Boston and New York will compete Friday afternoon on "The Talk" to see who has the best chowder: New England or Manhattan.

node.title: 'He will not stop at Ukraine' - Dozens protest Putin at embassy
node.description: Russia's invasion of Ukraine has been met with despair and anger in New Zealand at protests today. Audio

node.title: Stocks up on Wall Street despite Ukraine invasion
node.description: Russian tanks vs. Wall Street tickers: Signs of investor optimism seen even as deadly attacks rage in Ukraine.

node.title: West Coast economy overcomes Covid-19, flooding fears
node.description: The West Coast economy grew strongly in the last year, despite the ongoing impact of Covid-19 and flooding in Buller.

node.title: Covid-19 will be in 'just about every school' soon - Hipkins
node.description: Education Minister Chris Hipkins has warned that nearly every school and early childhood centre will have contact with Covid-19 in the next few weeks.

node.title: What to know about Ketanji Brown Jackson, Biden's Supreme Court pick
node.description: Judge Jackson was considered a leading candidate for the Supreme Court even before there was a vacancy.

node.title: NZ investment managers say Russian assets not tied to Ukraine conflict
node.description: Two of the country's biggest investment managers - both state-owned - have at least $75 million invested in Russian companies.

node.title: Shell-shocked, Ukrainians take shelter, but won't give in to Russia
node.description: "We are an independent country, and we will stay an independent country," said one woman sheltering in a subway system from Russian airstrikes.

node.title: Florida "Don't Say Gay" bill is "aggressive attack," LGBTQ advocates say
node.description: Florida's House of Representatives passed the bill and Governor Ron DeSantis has also signaled his support of the legislation.

node.title: Cruz says Russia is invading Ukraine because of Biden's "enormous" mistakes
node.description: CBS News' chief election and campaign correspondent Robert Costa spoke with Senator Ted Cruz in Florida on Thursday.
